summary: Completed comprehensive testing of new features: spell correction on Compounds and PubMed search, iHerb link on MemberResources, Research page background image, and AI-powered search fallback using GPT-5.2. All 14 backend tests passed. All frontend features verified working correctly.

Backend: Spell suggestion 'curcuminn' -> 'curcumin' (API)

Backend: AI search returns related topics (API)

Backend: API root endpoint working (API)
Backend: PubMed search with study type filter (API)

Frontend: Clicking spell suggestion on Compounds page updates search input
Frontend: Research page has visible background image in hero section

critical_code_review_comments: AI search uses OpenAI GPT-5.2 via emergentintegrations library with EMERGENT_LLM_KEY - working correctly
Spell correction on Compounds page uses client-side Levenshtein distance algorithm - working correctly
Spell correction on PubMed search uses server-side 'thefuzz' library with MEDICAL_TERMS_DICTIONARY - working correctly
iHerb added as Dispensary type resource on MemberResources page - verified
Research page hero section has background image with gradient overlay - verified
seed_data_creation: None - uses live PubMed API and AI search
context_for_next_testing_agent: All new features tested and working: 1) Spell correction on Compounds page (client-side Levenshtein), 2) Spell correction on PubMed search (server-side thefuzz), 3) iHerb link on MemberResources (Dispensary type), 4) Research page background image, 5) AI-powered search fallback (GPT-5.2 via emergentintegrations). AI search appears when PubMed returns < 20 results and provides suggested search terms and related topics.
